answers.answer: It sound's to me like symptoms of neuropathy... Are you by chance diabetic ? It's a common result of diabetes... My husband has it.. I know how you feel.. I have migraine's horribly and when I get them, the whole left side of my body goes "numb"....... I would ask your doc. about the possibilty of neuropathy...... Or testing for it.

Hi,Your symptom indeed suggests that it is due to neuropathy.Pain, tingling and numbness are signs of neuropathy. Nerve involvement may be single (mono-neuropathy) or multiple (poly-neuropathy).This peripheral nerve pathology can be due to Diabetes, Prediabetes, Vitamin deficiency, and altered blood pressure status, any nutritional deficiency, and abnormal endocrine status, compression of nerve or impingement of nerve at time of exit from Vertebrae. You should be doing HbA1C, ESR, serum protein/immuno-electrophoresis, and vitamin B12, BUN, and creatinine levels.Have you done any imaging study for your lumbar spine and cervical spine?Keep me informed if you have any queries.Bye.

question: THE ONLY WAY I CAN DESCRIBE MY PROBLEM IS THE FEELING THAT YOU GET WHEN YOU BANG YOUR ELBOW AND HIT YOUR NERVE ENDINGS, YOU GET THAT FUNNY FEELING THAT RUNS DOWN YOUR ARM.WELL I GET THAT FEELING ABOUT 50 TIMES A DAY DOWN ALL OF MY RIGHT SIDE, SOMETIMES ITS JUST DOWN MY NECK AND SOMETIMES IT CAN BE DOWN THE WHOLE OF MY BODY. THIS HAPPENS TO ME EVERYDAY AND EVEN WHILST WALKING, SOMETIMES MID WALK I GET A SPASM AND SOMETIMES IM CROSSING THE ROAD AND IT CAUSES MY BODY TO SHUDDER AND CAUSE ME TO SLOW DOWN AND ONCE NEARLY GOR RUN OVER.I HAVE TOLD MY DOCTOR BUT HE SAYS HE DOESNT KNOW WHAT THE PROBLEM COULD BE AND SENT ME FOR A SCAN WHICH CAME UP NEGATIVE.PLEASE HELP AS I AM GETTING VERY SCARED BECAUSE DAY BY DAY IT IS GETTING MORE FREQUENT AND MORE INTENSE.
title: Tingling feeling down the right side
